intro: Myrmechis gracilis, commonly known as the slender myrmecia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Myrmechis gracilis is typically found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
